page.title: 09 HOUSING IN OLD DRY SANDFORD
page.content: The houses are old they range from 200-400 years old.All of these houses have an upstairs and two have three storeys. These houses are built from old brick but have had some new bricks and roof tiles in to stop crumbling. Most people living in the older houses are AGED between 60 and 80,althogh there are some middle age people as well. An interesting house is called "THE OLD BARN".A man spent 2 years CONVERTING a barn into a house.The barn was used for storing grain ,it is now a luxurious home. The oldest house is called "The Vine Cottage".It is 400 years old. Dry Sandford got its name from some sandpits which were nearby. (Sharon Garner and Clare Morris)
